fields.description:
When customer generate a backup, the link to down backup file will no longer be there after a restart.
h2. Steps to Replicate
 # Generate a backup and verified the link to backup is created
 # Restart the instance
 # Navigate back to backup manager and notice that the link is no longer visible

h2. Expected Result

On the top of the backup manager, we wrote a line:
{quote}This backup file will replace the previous backup and will be automatically deleted after 7 days.
{quote}
It should be made available for 7 days if there are no further backup generated.
h2. Actual Result

The link is not available and there is no way to retrieve back the link apart from generating a new backup
h2. Use Case

For some customer's internal policy, they are required to take a periodical backup in case of disaster. Generating during the peak hours are not recommended since it might cause potential performance issue if the instance is huge. However, generating it after work expose to this bug (due to the daily maintenance). They have limited ways to reliably generate the backup.
fields.summary: Confluence Cloud Link to Backup File Gone after Restart

fields.description:
When trying to expand the container property of a container in the Confluence REST API, the API complains with 'java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Cannot recursively expand : container'.

Example: Retrieve the details of an attachment comment via [https://product-fabric.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/52901548?expand=container.] The expanded container property has a nested container property that I want to expand but calling [https://product-fabric.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/content/52901548?expand=container.container] does not work.

API returns:
{code:java}
statusCode": 500,
"message": "java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Cannot recursively expand : container"{code}
This should be a legitimate use of the API. The container of an attachment comment is the attachment itself and I want to know which container the attachment is in (e.g. which page).

 

Another example is a comment on a CQ answer where you would want to expand container multiple times:
{quote}answer-comment.container = answer
answer-comment.container.container = question
answer-comment.container.container.container = space (or null, for global questions)
{quote}
fields.summary: REST API: Cannot expand nested container property

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you have files attached to one page and link these files to another page, if this page where the links are being added is being edited by more than one user and the second user saves the page after the first user already saved it the links to the attachments change to the name of the page where the attachments are attached.
h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud version 1000.1070.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 pages
# Attach some files to one of the pages (let's call this page "repository")
# Edit the other page (let's call it "index") and click the "Insert link" button
# Search for the files that were attach to the "repository" page and add a link to one of them (do not save the page just yet)
# Access Confluence with another user and edit the "index" page with this second user and insert another link to another file from the "repository" page
# With the second user, save the page
# With the first user save, save the page as well

h3. Expected Results
The links and names to the attached files from the "repository" page would remain
h3. Actual Results
The links and names are changed to the name of the "repository" page (both link and name)

h3.Notes
See video attached when the first user adds the link, waits for the second user add another links and saves the page, then the first user saves the page as well and the links change.
!video.mp4!

h3. Notes II
This problem also occurs when the same user has two browser tabs opened, each tab is editing the same page.

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Links to files attached on another page change to the page name when the page is edited by more than one user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-52135].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
If more than one user is editing an Office file with the Office Connector, multiple versions of the document are created.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a way to merge changes between versions or allow users to simultaneously edit the same version.

h3. Why this is important
This is important because files edited through the Office Connector in this way will not be up-to-date and users will spend time looking for the differences and updating the document.
fields.summary: Allow concurrent collaborative editing to a single Office document

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-52132].
  {panel}

Reason:
Efficient user management for license count.

Implementation:
Under Admin section, add an option to manage inactive users near license details or under license details.
When clicked, it shows
UI:
“Mark user(s) inactive for license count if user has not logged more than [BOX] days.”
Note: Where “BOX” would take any positive integer larger than 7 days.

Check here to “Run now”. [Click box]

Feature on backend:
1. Confluence checks this automatically every and marks user inactive for license count until user logs in again.
2. Runs the same operation as in #1 when admin clicks “Run now”. Displays the log entry of users marked inactive on screen besides adding it in the confluence log.

Logging:
Confluence log should have entry like:
User <user-id> was last logged on <date/time> marking it inactive for license count based on “[BOX]” day on in-activity configuration at <date & time stamp>.
fields.summary: Enhancement request regarding the user management(license)
Remove 'Pages' from Breadcrumbs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-52115].
  {panel}

A recent update to Confluence changed the way pages are saved/published after editing.  There are now two buttons: "Update" and "Save and Close".  It's not immediately apparent what these do.

My first guess was that "Update" would incorporate any changes published by my colleagues into the draft I'm currently working on.  Instead "Update" actually _publishes_ the draft that you're currently working on.  Thus, the "Update" button would more clearly communicate its purpose with the text "Publish".

My first guess for the "Save and Close" button was that it would publish the draft I'm currently working on and return me to viewing the page.  This is similar to how Confluence previously worked.  Instead, this button saves the current draft and returns to viewing the current published version of the page.  This has confused some of my colleagues as well who frantically state that Confluence just lost all their work!  Instead of "Save and Close", this button should read "Save _Draft_ and Close" (without the emphasis of course).

*These changes would really help people understand what the buttons do and prevent literally _hours_ of frustration from people re-creating all their work that is already available in a draft!*
fields.summary: Change "Save and Close" to "Save Draft and Close"

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-52105].
  {panel}

h3. Summary 
When a user is disabled in LDAP, all his previous page and space watches are still stored in the {{notifications}} table in the Confluence database. This results in the issue in this KB to occur: 
* [Email notifications trigger a NoSuchElementException in the logs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/email-notifications-trigger-a-nosuchelementexception-in-the-logs-747443312.html/] 

Those entries need to be manually removed for each disabled user and can be undesirable once you have a large number of disabled users. 

h3. Suggestion 
Automatically remove a user's watch subscriptions once they've been transitioned to 'Disabled'.
fields.summary: Automatically remove an LDAP user's watch subscriptions once they are disabled

h3. Problem Definition

Team Calendars color palette have a limited number of colors - 21 to be precise.

 
h3. Suggested Solution

Increase the number of available colors to use, or enable a color picker to customize the event colors.

 
h3. Why this is important

Some customers have too many events to track, and the color is a very useful resource for visualization purposes.

 
h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: More color options in Team Calendar

When adding *JIRA Issue Dates* as events in Team Calendars, the dropdown only includes the first 8 projects in JIRA (in alphabetical order). In some cases, depending on how large the pop-up is, the dropdown will show fewer than 8.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a scrollbar on the dropdown, so that all JIRA projects are visible in the pop-up. 
 
h3. Workaround 
Switching to the JQL (advanced) search option allows you to select any project. To initiate the dropdown, you can type \{\{project=}}.
fields.summary: Not all projects appear in JIRA Issue Dates dropdown when trying to create events in Team Calendars

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, synchrony properties default to a same-node configuration.

h3. Suggested Solution
From our guide on [Configuring Synchrony for Data Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-synchrony-for-data-center-858772125.html/], the following properties default to either localhost or 127.0.0.1
{code}
-Dsynchrony.cluster.bind
-Dsynchrony.bind
-Dcluster.interfaces
{code}

If we could set them to default to the server's IP, or leave them as a blank default setting for data center/cluster installations, then this could make the setup easier for clustered instances. Normally our customers [following this guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/installing-confluence-data-center-203603.html] will set up a Synchrony cluster, where these properties have to be set explicitly on startup. A synchrony service setup guide would be helpful for this as well: [CONF-51792|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-51792]. 
 
h3. Workaround 
Set them manually
fields.summary: Change default Synchrony properties based on setup type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51986].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

In Team Calendars, users can drag and drop events from one date to another. However, it's not possible to select multiple events and move them together by the same offset.

 
h3. Suggested Solution


Enable the ability to select multiple events at once and move them together. 
For example, you have an "event A" from day 20-23 and the "event B" from day 21-26. If was possible to select them together and move them over 1 day, the result would be the "event A" from 21-24 and "event B" from 22-27

 
h3. Why this is important


This is important because some users need to reorganize multiple event dates, and it's only possible to drag the events one by one.

 
h3. Workaround


None
fields.summary: Ability to select multiple events and move them together in Team Calendars

  {panel}

We use Confluence as collabarative information system and all colleagues are allowed to read (nearly) all pages.

This causes that our daily update mails contain a lot of changes and it is difficult to filter out relevant information.
We mark our relevant spaces as favorite spaces and use the favorites as "space quick link".

We would like to have the ability to subscribe daily updates for either all spaces (with permission) or for favorite spaces only.

 

 

 

!image-2017-03-23-08-23-56-961.png!
fields.summary: As Confluence User I want to subscribe daily updates for favorite spaces only.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51952].
  {panel}

A part of my team are updating a wiki page when they are working on something not relevant to me. I am getting spammed down by email from Confluence whenever they update the page.
 I would normally tell them to uncheck "Notify watchers" when updating, but they need to notify each other. So I've tried to just unwatch that specific page. But Confluence won't let me! I can only unwatch it if I unwatch the entire space as well, which is not what I want, because I need to be informed about other updates to the space. I just don't want all the Confluence spam resulting from edits to that page.

So please let me uncheck the "Watch this page" option, which is currently just giving me:
 "You will receive updates for this page because you are watching this space"

I want to simply unwatch a specific page, but keep watching the rest of the space. Is that too much to ask for?
fields.summary: Ability to unwatch a specific page, but still watch rest of pages in the same space

Confluence upgrade task will failed if the pre-upgrade Oracle DB dialect uses column data types that do not support Unicode (VARCHAR data type). This will need a modification of the database column that uses VARCHAR2 datatype to NVARCHAR2 datatype as per knowledge base article below:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/confluence-upgrade-fails-because-oracle-could-not-complete-schema-update-838275652.html

Therefore, it is much convenient if we could implement a schema to accept the VARCHAR2 datatype for ease of upgrading Confluence.

Snippet from Oracle documentation which recommend using VARCHAR2 over NVARCHAR2 datatype:
!docs-oracle-marked-paragraphs.png|thumbnail!
Link: http://docs.oracle.com/database/121/NLSPG/ch6unicode.htm#NLSPG319
fields.summary: Implement Oracle database schema to accept VARCHAR2 datatype for Confluence database column.

h3. Summary
At the moment, Atlassian is not certified by any of the Standards organizations. Atlassian _has_ implemented a security management program to align with the principles of ISO 27001 and ISO 27002, but are not currently certified at this time. 

See this link to learn more about [Atlassian's Security Management Program|https://www.atlassian.com/security/security-management-program].

h3. Suggestion
Either provide certification, or the means to gain certification to ISO 26262 – Functional Safety in the Automobile industry.
fields.summary: Provide the means to be compliant with ISO 26262 Functional Safety in the Automobile industry

h3. Problem Definition
Since Confluence 5.10.x, the option to change the flush indexing queue interval is not editable anymore as per the previous versions of Confluence, where you can modify the interval by following the steps outlined in the [How do I modify the frequency of content indexing?|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=104300776] KB article.

h3. Suggested Solution
To provide an option for Confluence Administrator to reconfigure the job's interval at their end.

h3. Why this is important
With the current default value set to 5 seconds from the previous 5 minutes interval, this might be an expensive task to be completed for some customers.
fields.summary: Option to Reconfigure Flush Edge Index Queue Job's Interval

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in the Confluence Audit Log, there is no way to filter which items appear in the logs. Since we added User Management changes to the Audit Log in CONF-6960, a filtering option should be made available. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a filtering option for the audit log, much like what JIRA has, that would allow administrators to select which actions should be logged in the audit. Please see below for an example: 
!audit_log_filter.png|thumbnail!

h3. Why this is important
The inability to filter actions in the audit log can have some negative impacts. For example, administrators will sync over their external user directories from LDAP or Crowd and the sync results in thousands of entries in the Audit Log, sometimes even millions of entries. 

This makes it difficult to see unique actions logged in the audit because the logs are flooded with entries from the sync.
fields.summary: Add Filtering for Audit Log Entries

Confluence can read files from the local server when they're stored in <confluence-install>/confluence folder. Confluence could provide permission definition for unattached files stored on <confluence-install>/confluence folder.

It would be a nice feature to be able to customize the calendar timeline so that events of the same type remain aligned on the horizontal access.

The attached pics show what this could look like for one of the event types, but it would only be useful if it worked for all event types.

Current behavior:

!ConfluenceCalendarUpdate_original.png|thumbnail!

Suggestion:

!ConfluenceCalendarUpdate_modified.png|thumbnail!

Having a check-box or radio box would be a huge help to organizing the timeline.

We can lock-in which event is in which row so they don’t change when you add or delete events. For the calendar to be easily digested quickly keeping events in a consistent location is important.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51891].
  {panel}

When pressing '[' while editing a page, Confluence opens a list of "Link suggestions" that contains recently edited pages. This is indeed a great heuristics and often contains the page that I want to link to.

However, as soon as a second key is pressed, a different algorithm kicks in, often causing the recently edited pages to be removed from the suggestions list - _even if they match the characters just entered_.

This is incredibly annoying to me because it punishes me for typing too much, especially in combination with the delays naturally occurring in that flow (while Confluence is building up the lists). For example, when I insert a link by typing '[' + a few letters of its title, I can see the desired page appearing in the list and, as soon as I try to select it, have it disappear again :(

I suggest tweaking the algorithm so that matching items in the list of recently edited pages are ranked higher than other items. (Maybe display them in a separate compartment of the "Link suggestions" list.)
fields.summary: Make the "Link suggestions" more stable

With SPA enabled, the steps to work on daily operations are hugely different. One of the examples is: 
* Old UI: We will be redirected to the space homepage when we click on space logo.
* SPA: We will be redirected to the last visited column (Overview/Pages/Blogs) when we click on space logo.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51854].
  {panel}

When an attachment is deleted it still appears in searches and can be accessed.  This is a potential security issue if a user accidentally uploads privileged information and needs to clear it.

Removing old page versions does not fix this problem.

Purging the attachment from the space's trash does remove it from searches.  After this action, an old link to the attachment produces a strange "dead end" page with a blank attachment overlay and no exit or home link. [^PageDisplayedFromDeletedAttachmentLink .png] 

I would expect that when a user deletes an attachment it becomes invisible.  The action to should not require a space admin.

The page produced from an old link to a removed attachment could also be improved with a message and escape option.
fields.summary: Weird and potentially insecure attachment deletion

h3. Problem Definition
The documentation [Confluence Server REST API Documentation|https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/REST/latest-server/] does not have any reference to [Cross Site Request Forgery (CSRF) protection changes in Atlassian REST|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/cross-site-request-forgery-csrf-protection-changes-in-atlassian-rest-779294918.html] which causing issues for the customers using REST API for their customizations. 
The mention link highlight the importance of correct headers in the REST API request to Confluence.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add Warning reference on the page [Confluence Server REST API Documentation|https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/REST/latest-server/] to the KB [Cross Site Request Forgery (CSRF) protection changes in Atlassian REST|https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/cross-site-request-forgery-csrf-protection-changes-in-atlassian-rest-779294918.html]
fields.summary: Add XSRF protection documentation link to Confluence Server REST API Reference page

h3. Problem Definition

Due to connection failures it's possible the database connection between Confluence and the database can be severed by a network failure. This can result in Confluence requiring a restart to fix the connection.

h3. Suggested Solution

Enable the appropriate {{preferredTestQuery}} setting by default for new installations of Confluence.
 
h3. Workaround 
This is mitigated by enabling a {{preferredTestQuery}} as per [Surviving Connection Closures|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Surviving+Database+Connection+Closures].
fields.summary: Configure database defaults to include the preferredTestQuery

        at java.lang.Enum.valueOf(Enum.java:238)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.model.EnumProperty.getEnumValue(EnumProperty.java:41)
...
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
The import failed as some non-nullable values in the {{cwd_directory}} table are {{NULL}} in the Cloud generated XML backup, e.g. _implementationClass_, _lowerImplementationClass_ and _type_ parameters. Whereby, by default only the _description_ column of {{cwd_directory}} table is allowed to be nullable - in both Confluence Server and Confluence Cloud Database.
 {code}
<object class="DirectoryImpl" package="com.atlassian.crowd.model.directory">
<id name="id">98305</id>
<property name="name"><![CDATA[Confluence Internal Directory]]></property>
<property name="lowerName"><![CDATA[confluence internal directory]]></property>
<property name="createdDate">2016-11-21 08:31:58.196</property>
<property name="updatedDate">2016-11-21 08:31:58.196</property>
<property name="active">true</property>
<property name="description"/><property name="implementationClass"/><property name="lowerImplementationClass"/><property name="type" enum-class="DirectoryType" package="com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api"/><collection name="attributes" class="java.util.Map"></collection>
</object>
{code}

Therefore, as a workaround we'd then need to modify the {{entities.xml}} file as per follow and retried to import it in Confluence server again.
{code}
<object class="DirectoryImpl" package="com.atlassian.crowd.model.directory">
<id name="id">98305</id>
<property name="name"><![CDATA[Confluence Internal Directory]]></property>
<property name="lowerName"><![CDATA[confluence internal directory]]></property>
<property name="createdDate">2016-11-21 08:31:58.196</property>
<property name="updatedDate">2016-11-21 08:31:58.196</property>
<property name="active">true</property>
<property name="description"><![CDATA[Confluence default internal directory]]></property>
<property name="implementationClass"><![CDATA[com.atlassian.crowd.directory.InternalDirectory]]></property>
<property name="lowerImplementationClass"><![CDATA[com.atlassian.crowd.directory.internaldirectory]]></property>
<property name="type" enum-class="DirectoryType" package="com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api">INTERNAL</property>
<collection name="allowedOperations" class="java.util.Set"><element enum-class="OperationType" package="com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api">UPDATE_USER_ATTRIBUTE</element>
<element enum-class="OperationType" package="com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api">CREATE_USER</element>
<element enum-class="OperationType" package="com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api">UPDATE_GROUP_ATTRIBUTE</element>
<element enum-class="OperationType" package="com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api">UPDATE_USER</element>
<element enum-class="OperationType" package="com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api">DELETE_ROLE</element>
<element enum-class="OperationType" package="com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api">DELETE_GROUP</element>
<element enum-class="OperationType" package="com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api">DELETE_USER</element>
<element enum-class="OperationType" package="com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api">CREATE_GROUP</element>
<element enum-class="OperationType" package="com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api">CREATE_ROLE</element>
<element enum-class="OperationType" package="com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api">UPDATE_GROUP</element>
<element enum-class="OperationType" package="com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api">UPDATE_ROLE</element>
<element enum-class="OperationType" package="com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.api">UPDATE_ROLE_ATTRIBUTE</element>
</collection>
<collection name="attributes" class="java.util.Map"><element name="user_encryption_method" type="string"><![CDATA[atlassian-security]]></element>
</collection>
</object>
{code}

(!) If the directory attributes are missing, be sure to add it back to the {{entities.xml}} file. Otherwise, users in the internal directory won't be able to log in. In particular, this XML block needs to exist:

{code}
<collection name="attributes" class="java.util.Map"><element name="user_encryption_method" type="string"><![CDATA[atlassian-security]]></element>
</collection>
{code}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51814].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Audit log doesn't provide information for created/deleted pages in Confluence, and the editing can be only viewed through Page History.
h3. Suggested Solution

Please, provide an option to enable the audit log for page changes.
h3. Why this is important

Some customers need more detailed information about the changes done in Confluence, and the audit log provides information only in a space level.
fields.summary: Detailed audit log for Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51812].
  {panel}

*CURRENT BEHAVIOUR*
Synchrony tables are append-only at this time. As the tables increase in size they may become too large for some databases which could cause performance issue while saving pages.

It would me convenience if we introduce a Scheduled job to empty Synchrony tables in Confluence in order to improve the performance.

*WORKAROUND*
Truncate the Synchrony tables as discussed in the knowledge base article below:
* [How to reduce the size of Synchrony tables|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-reduce-the-size-of-synchrony-tables-858770831.html]
fields.summary: Introduce a Scheduled job to empty Synchrony tables in Confluence.

fields.summary: Cannot purge page
Remove spam from Community Page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51792].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In case of Confluence Server synchrony is deployed on the same container as Confluence and it's starting together with Confluence and can be controlled from Confluence interface.
In case of Confluence Data Center the synchrony nodes can be deployed separately.

h5. Suggestion
Please provide the documentation on how to install synchrony as a service on Windows and Linux hosts.
fields.summary: Documentation for configuring Synchrony to run as a service in the DC

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-51787].
  {panel}

Hello 

Can you consider to implement such workaround for this really old issue: 

[http://jsbin.com/napuvihata/1/edit?js,console,output]

This solution seems to be quite nice and easy to implement. 

!image-2017-03-10-09-24-33-480.png!

Safari is the only official supported browser for MS Office / Sharepoint on MacOS.

  {panel}

h2. NOTE: You can now un-subscribe yourself from Atlassian Answers notifications.

Simply click the "Un-subscribe from all notifications" link that appears in the email footer of all emails that are now sent from Answers.
Some users may find that clicking the link results in a system error message - even though this happens, the unsubscribe request should still have been processed successfully.

-------

The old Atlassian Answers had a number of fine-grained notification options that allowed users to control which emails they received from the system.

Many users were able to completely de-activate any emails from being sent, even though technically they were probably subscribed to a bunch of questions or topics.

When we migrated Answers to Confluence Questions, these notification controls were lost, but each user's subscriptions were kept intact.  Now, many users have started receiving emails that they do not want to get.

We are planning to build a self-service unsubscribe option into Confluence Questions itself (see [CQ-1334]). However, this may take some time to implement, and many users want a solution immediately.

As an interim measure, let's create a process for Atlassian staff to manually un-subscribe users from all emails if they request it.
fields.summary: Un-subscribe users from all emails from Atlassian Answers if they have requested it
Popular filter doesn't cover the FAQ usecase
